what: Data about hybrid open access journal publishing
title: Data about hybrid open access journal publishing
text: package contains information open access uptake hybrid journals. main purpose hoaddata provide data Hybrid Open Access Dashboard (HOAD), developed SUB Göttingen support Deutsche Forschungsgemeinschaft. making data available R package, hoaddata can also used data analytics tasks R. data cover publication period 2017 - 2023.

title: Data about hybrid open access journal publishing
text: can install hoaddata GitHub :

title: Data about hybrid open access journal publishing
text: package combines open data multiple sources follows: Journals included transformative agreements obtained cOAlition S Transformative Agreements Public Data (July 2021, July 2022 May 23 snapshots). Agreements German consortia derived Germany’s Open Access Monitor (March 2022). enriched journal data sources ISSN-L, linking identifier ISSN variants. , excluded fully open access journals cOAlition S Transformative Agreements Public Data cross-checking several datasets fully open access journals: Directory Open Access Journals (DOAJ), Bielefeld GOLD OA Unpaywall. Crossref main data source determining publication volume hybrid journals including uptake Open Access Creative Commons licenses. ESAC guidelines, community recommendation negotiating transformative agreements, require publishers make key metadata elements publicly available Crossref, Creative Commons licensing information Open Access articles. Crossref Metadata Plus subscriber, used monthly Crossref snapshots derive publication data. OpenAlex data source determining country affiliation lead authors. lead author first named author scholarly article usually carried research presented article, although author roles can vary across disciplines. used OpenAlex monthly snaphots data source determine lead author affiliations. highlight potential gaps Crossref open licensing metadata information provided via journal webpages, used Unpaywall via OpenAlex complementary data source Open Access articles hybrid journals.

title: Data about hybrid open access journal publishing
text: data-raw folder contains R code used generate hoaddata datasets. data obtained connecting subugoe-collaborative scholarly data warehouse, collection big scholarly datasets hosted Google Big Query maintained SUB Göttingen. Crossref used determine publication volume articles made available CC license, affiliation data gathered OpenAlex. can find corresponding SQL code inst/sql/ folder. data package automatically built using GitHub Actions. Every merge event main branch triggers data update calling scripts data-raw/ folder. Data changes merged package tracked Git. makes easy update reproduce different versions data contained hoaddata.

title: Data about hybrid open access journal publishing
text: Datasets released public domain. Anyone free copy, modify, publish, use, compile, sell, distribute materials form, purpose, commercial non-commercial, means. Crossref asserts claims ownership individual items bibliographic metadata associated Digital Object Identifiers (DOIs) acquired use Crossref Free Services. Individual items bibliographic metadata associated DOIs may cached incorporated user’s content systems. OpenAlex Journal Checker Tool data made available CC0 license. Transformative Agreements Public Data made available CC0 license. work re-used following dataset: Pollack, Philipp; Lindstrot, Barbara; Barbers, Irene, Stanzel, Franziska, 2021, “Open Access Monitor: Zeitschriftenlisten (V2)”, https://doi.org/10.26165/JUELICH-DATA/VTQXLM. published CC 4.0.

Hybrid OA publishing output from first authors — cc_articles
text: object class tbl_df (inherits tbl, data.frame) 1511229 rows 6 columns.

title: Hybrid OA publishing output from first authors — cc_articles
text: first author often considered lead author (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lead_author) usually undertaken research presented article, although author roles can vary across disciplines. used OpenAlex data source determining lead author's affiliation. case OpenAlex record country affiliation, extracted country names display_name using regular expressions. Variables: doi DOI OA article issn_l Linking ISSN cr_year Earliest publication year (Crossref field `issued`) cc Normalized Creative Commons variant. country_code country institution located, represented ISO two-letter country code. (OpenAlex field `country_code` extra country extraction) ror ROR Organizational ID knowledge, OpenAlex provide information corresponding  authors affiliation.

text: object class tbl_df (inherits tbl, data.frame) 1981677 rows 6 columns.

title: First author country affiliations per journal, year and Creative Commons license — jn_aff
text: Country affiliations determined using first author affiliation listed OpenAlex. first author often considered lead author(https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lead_author) usually undertaken research presented article, although author roles can vary across disciplines. Note full counting every original article review counted per country affiliation first authors applied. first authors can multiple affiliations different countries, use dataset, jn_ind determine journal's publication volume. Variables: issn_l Linking ISSN cr_year Earliest publication year (Crossref field `issued`) country_code country institution located, represented ISO two-letter country code. (OpenAlex field `country_code`) cc Normalized Creative Commons variant. NA represents articles, provided CC license articles_under_cc_variant Number articles Creative Commons variant, grouped journal, year country affiliation articles_total Yearly journal output year country affiliation

title: First author country affiliations per journal, year and Creative Commons license — jn_aff

what: Prevalence of Creative Commons licenses by variant, year and journal — jn_ind
title: Prevalence of Creative Commons licenses by variant, year and journal — jn_ind
text: dataset contains number proportion open access articles Creative Commons license (CC) license variant year hybrid journals included cOAlition S Journal Checker Tool.

title: Prevalence of Creative Commons licenses by variant, year and journal — jn_ind
Prevalence of Creative Commons licenses by variant, year and journal — jn_ind
text: object class tbl_df (inherits tbl, data.frame) 123770 rows 6 columns.

title: Prevalence of Creative Commons licenses by variant, year and journal — jn_ind
text: Publication period 2017 - 2022. Journal's article volume calculated using Crossref metadata snapshot. Note articles published regular issues aside supplements containing conference contributions like meeting abstracts, indicated non-numeric pagination, included. Also, non-scholarly journal content, table contents excluded. , followed Unpaywall's paratext recognition approach, expanded include patterns indicating corrections. CC licenses also identified Crossref. License information author accepted manuscripts ("aam") considered. Variables: issn_l Linking ISSN cr_year Earliest publication year (Crossref field `issued`) cc Normalized Creative Commons variant. Ordered factor license variant permissiveness cc_total Number articles Creative Commons variant jn_all Yearly journal output prop Proportion CC licensed articles

title: Hybrid Journals listed in the Open Access Monitor — oam_hybrid_jns
text: Pollack, Philipp; Lindstrot, Barbara; Barbers, Irene, Stanzel, Franziska 2022, Open Access Monitor: Zeitschriftenlisten (v2) https://doi.org/10.26165/JUELICH-DATA/VTQXLM

title: Hybrid Journals listed in the Open Access Monitor — oam_hybrid_jns
text: direct data exchange Crossref ISSN agency. Instead, publishers register journal-level metadata first deposit metadata given journal, including ISSN(s). Crossref makes sure article journal metadata match. info Crossref's handling ISSN registration can found support thread: https://community.crossref.org/t/parallel-titles---given-issn/2183 Variables: agreement Transformative agreement German consortium lead Institution leading nationwide consortium cr_journal_id Crossref journal ID issn International Standard Serial Number (ISSN), ID refer specific journal's media version
